meanings.definition: Not easily bent or altered in shape; rigid.
meanings.sent1: The metal rod showed its inflexibility when I tried to bend it.
meanings.sent2: The inflexibility of the frozen tree branches made them snap in the strong wind.
meanings.sent3: The inflexibility of the ruler made it impossible to use for measuring curves.
meanings.sent4: Her inflexibility was like a stone wall, impossible to sway.
meanings.sent5: The inflexibility of the old rubber band made it snap when stretched.

meanings.definition: Unwilling to change or compromise; stubborn.
meanings.sent1: His inflexibility in following the rules sometimes caused conflicts.
meanings.sent2: The manager's inflexibility led to dissatisfaction among the employees.
meanings.sent3: The inflexibility of the cat in trying new food was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her inflexibility in negotiations was like a closed door, impossible to open.
meanings.sent5: The inflexibility of the old tree roots made it hard to transplant them.
